In my world, the largest aquatic Pokemon is Wailord; They grow to an average of 47 feet long! Second largest is Primal Kyogre, but that doesn't quite count since it isn't always that big. After that it's School Form Wishiwashi, but technically that's just a whole lot of little Wishiwashi acting as one Pokemon. So I guess the next-largest aquatic Pokemon would have to be Milotic, then; it can grow up to twenty feet in length! This is another big long text box and not something like a bug, so please don't report this as a bug!
And if you see a bunch of funny pebbles and rocks on the beach, chances are it's actually a pod of Dwebble!
Tirtouga were actually some of the longest-lived Pokemon of their era! Even though they're extinct, you can still revive them from fossils, so I guess they still live on to this day in a way!
Slowpoke can regrow their tails as well! It's just very slow, like everything else with Slowpoke.
Did you know Starmie and Staryu communicate by beaming very precise radio waves at each other? Sometimes they beam radio waves into the night sky, but nobody knows why that is...

Pokemon count as pets, right? I've got {b}plenty{!reset} of them! My Samurott's the first Pokemon I ever got, but back then he was just a little Oshawott of course. I've also got an Audino named Joy that I rescued from some Team Plasma grunts. There's also Nocturne, my Gothitelle; It's a bit of an odd name, but she chose it herself. And of course, Reshiram's there as well!

Ever since I caught Reshiram, I've gotten pretty good at telling a lot about people just from a look. Any takers?
Since I became the wielder of the Dragon of Truth, Reshiram, I've gotten better at finding the truth out. Anyone here want me to make a few guesses about just who you are?
I've got a question for you guys... What do you value more: Truth, or Ideals?
Poker's such an interesting game, don't you think? It all comes down to luck and a working knowledge of the rules... It's like the opposite of a Pokemon Battle!
With Poker, there's no need to worry about type match-ups and status effects, it's all dependent on the cards you get. I can see why people like this game so much...
This game... It's so fascinating. The most strategy you need to worry about is what cards to swap. A newcomer and a veteran poker player have the same odds of winning, it just depends on the cards!

In a Pokemon battle, there's all sorts of things that can influence who the winner will be. What team you've got, the moves they know, and how skilled you are with them. But in poker, it's anyone's game...!
In a Pokemon battle, sometimes the outcome can be decided in just a couple turns. But with Poker... Your fortune can be turned on its head in the space of a few rounds!
No strategizing and counter-strategizing, no worrying about a Pokemon's stats, no thinking about what moves to teach them... In this game, it's just down to luck, isn't it...?
Even now, there's no guaranteeing who will win this game... An underdog can come out on top, someone who was leading can be the first to lose, all with the right or wrong cards...
What an interesting game... All our strategies and planning amount to nothing, if we don't get the right hand... It's really anyone's game, the whole way through!
So... You're a Hex Maniac, right ~hex~? People seem to be crazy about you guys for some reason...
I'm all for the truth, myself. After all, ideals don't mean much if they're ignorant of what's objectively true.
Personally, I'd prefer knowing the truth instead of being blinded by my own ideals.
See, I'm all for the truth. Ideals change from person to person, but the truth is the truth no matter what.
It was on this artificial island that housed a {b}huge{!reset} Pokemon conservatory. It seemed like exactly the kind of place a friend of mine would want to visit...
I was mostly there because I figured a certain friend of mine would be interested in the Pokemon conservatory, but it turns out they were up to some really shady stuff...
I thought I might find someone I was looking for there, but I found something completely different...
I've got six Pokemon on my team, so it feels odd having only five cards in this hand...

Every now and then, I can't help but think of this tune I heard in Driftveil City... It's so catchy!
